content.description: the face requires some moving out right and back while passing through the red dolomite and possibly a hand jam to get around the quartzite cap.
content.location: This route is on the left end the Crest Wall or about 40 feet right of the Crest Top Climbout/Descent pathway.

content.description: Wasp Fakers begin in a steep shallow corner and soon accesses the left arete to climb over the face between the two unpromising lines of the left and right cracks.  Next it angles right to gain the crack right of the projected crack of where the route began and continues up this short crack to a big ledge and rap bolts.
A steep corner with several bulges to move past
The route proceed up the inside corner stemming and face climbing up to bulbous red rock and finishes near the top the white dolomite cap.
content.location: 2nd route from left in the Crest Wall cove.

content.description: Turning on Divinity Street right at the left transition from stained Blanco Wall to red rock wall.  The route begins in dihederal and move up a series of block by often going onto the left arete and finishes on an easier section of the quatzite cap.
An initially steep face climb leading to lower angle dolomite with smaller holds.
content.location: The right route above a prominent dead tree trunk.

content.description: Climb in the vicinity of a shallow lip faced crack to a roof with a close out of intermittent crack features to a stance on a shelf.  Next, figure out the exit.
content.location: 2nd route from left in the flat and deepest section of the Crest Wall Cove.

content.description: A hummocky series of bulges leads to some yellowish dolmite the appears featureless.  Porceed left across this face.
content.location: about in the middle of this zone of red rock where the base trail is along the climbing wall base.

content.description: Begin in what appears to be a seeming unusable intermittent crack in the corner of some bulges and ledges.  Proceed up and onto the steep dolomite face.
content.location: this is the 2nd route left of the left side of the Blanco Wall.

content.description: Red Cloud gets Wounded Knee is a route of intricate move and balance while trusting you feet. It too has a roof problem going through the quartzite cap.
This mind focusing route takes a lot of micro adjustments for the feet to set up for the next move.  If you do it too slow you meet the the Red Baron scoring another hit.

While on this White Wall figure out the moves thru, around or inside the book section and proceed to the projecting dolomite roof.  After standing upon the top ledge of this roof you can clip the anchor bolts.
content.location: The route lies just left of the center of the Blanco wall.  You can spot a bolt hanger on the vertical horizon of the final roof.

content.description: a difficult face start leads to intermittant crack and jug holds but the hard part is passing the dolomite roof.
content.location: This route is second route left of prominent outside corner

content.description: The beginning is steep but with big hold and after a ledge in the middle, one can get to the marbled headwall of smaller handholds sooner than one thinks.  Don't quit thinking as you are clipping the lowering bolt.  Cow Feat Pete did and had to return for an honest summiting.
content.location: Find the start of this climb just up and left from the low point of the base trail.  Here you will be perched on the cliff top of the white Madison Limestone.

content.description: This lone route's face gently sweeps upward and gets steeper to a mild overhang in the capping quartzite rock.
Some crack climbing and laybacking lead to a awkward perch under a mild overhang for some hand grouping to find the best hold.
content.location: West of the Blanco Wall where the base trail is next to the climbing wall.

content.description: Face climb steep strenuous overhanging sections with some long reaches to a most difficult finish on the scanty featured dolomite.
content.location: This route lies just right of center of the Blanco Wall.

content.description: Passing several section of bulges and will get you to easier going on the dolomite cap rock.
content.location: Find this climb on the very right side of the Blaco Wall.  The rock turns red just right of this climb.

content.description: Some steep reachy face holds lead to a right traverse but soon you will be try to figure out how to get out of the upper dihederal.
content.location: To the right of the Crest Top is a section of marbled quartzite/sandstone rock of alternating red and whitish yellow colors.  This route is to the right of the Crest Top Rock and on the left edge of the Marbled Wall.

content.description: Climb the arete leading right onto the face and up left then right to the roof and don't goof getting stood up as this is your proof.
Proceed along an offset seam to a cleft roof and upward into a corner.  Steep big hold lead out of the corner.  This route offer some unusual position for resting.
content.location: Just right of the Crest Top Rock that is whitish-grey dolomite.

content.description: Finding some hidden holds will get one past the steep start easily but hooking the anchor bolts that are on the vertical face of the summit roof can be a game of missing your tag transfer.
content.location: From a  downward to the right sloping base trail is a single coldshut anchor.  Star here and finish at the bolts seen on the vertical skyline..

content.description: Work you way up a less featured inside corner to a shallow dihederal and finish crossing right and up on the white dolomite.
content.location: Route begins above a prominent gray dead Juniper Tree trunk.

content.description:
Climb left of the prominent outside corner (whitish)

into the overhanging red rock and up to a corner of the dolmite base and past this bulge.
content.location: Just left of the prominent corner to the right of a big cave.

climbs.name: Crossfit  Vudoo Training
climbs.fa: Jone, Cow Feat Pete and Sailor Sally

content.description: Big holds at first lead to smaller holds after the midway ledge and then the clip to the anchors requires some negotiating.
content.location: This route begins to the right of the Crest Top Tower where the trail descends to it lowest point below the Marble Wall.

content.description: Face climb to a shallow thin crack dihederal briefly doing one finger jam? Then comes a lot of open palm hand holds.
content.location: This route is the right most route that lies below the Crest Top Rock.

content.description: Just right of the major left facing dihederal of Visiting Red Lodge is an overhanging bulge with some bolt visible on near horizontal skyline.  After surmounting this bulge there are 3 variation thru overhangs leading to the summit of Crest Top Tower.
content.location: Just right of the major left facing dihederal on the right side of the deep wall of the Crest Wall Cove.

content.description: Cross right from a major corner to a mildly overhanging corner and proceed to roof of dolomite. Proceed past the left (4th) bolt.  The extraneous hanger to right is a variation (project) that gets you to the curx of Imperchable.
content.location: This is the 1st route right of the prominent dead tree where the rock angle steepens considerable and the beginning of where the base trail lies at the foot of the climbing wall.

content.description: A steep but easy route on big holds.
content.location: This route lies at the western end of the Red Clove Wall or just right of the chain area at the base trail.

content.description: A few move of difficult stemming lead to access of the holds on the left face.  The climb get easier until the dolomite cap.
content.location: Just right of a very shallow gully at the left side of the Crest Wall Cove

content.description: On this white surface, the holds are few, so glide past them with little concern for the problem is to finish.
content.location: Blanco wall of the Red Clove wall, route is on the left side of the Blanco wall  just right of Turning on Divinity Street.

content.description: climb thru the crack and ledges using some open handholds to gain the dolomite cap rock face finish.
content.location: 1st route left of the left side of the Blanco Wall.

content.description: The route is quite easy from the start until nearing the roof.  The quartzite cap will not allow passage anywhere and anyway but the meter is running.

pathTokens: Area 5:  Red and White Grotto Walls
